en_first_half: Jake: younger brother to West (and only slightly less good-looking) and that type of college friend who knows everything about my life at UCLA but has never met my father, who lives only an hour away.
en_second_half: Jake introduced me to West; now Jake will be my sole remaining connection to West. The thought makes me a little sad, but then I remember I have the couch and T-virus zombies waiting for me inside.
en_results_raw: completion Jake often found it amusing how his brother, West, seemed to have this invisible connection to their family despite living across the country. West, with his charming personality and keen interest in everything Jake, had become an integral part of his life at UCLA. It was as if he had a twin who knew all his secrets, yet remained a stranger to his most personal relationships. This peculiar dynamic was a source of endless banter between the brothers, who communicated almost daily through a flurry of texts, videos, and late-night phone calls. Jake's friends often marveled at the bond he shared with his brother, especially considering the geographical divide. They would tease him about needing to introduce West to his father, a man who, despite living just an hour away, remained an enigma to West. Jake always laughed it off, knowing full well that introducing his brother to his father was a task easier said than done. His father, a man of few words and even fewer interests outside of his work, had always been guarded about his personal life. Jake's friends, however, were insistent, seeing it as the perfect opportunity for Jake to bridge the gap between his two worlds. They envisioned a heartwarming family reunion, where West's charm would finally break down the barriers his father had built over the years. Jake, though hesitant, couldn't deny the appeal of such a scenario. It would be a chance to finally bring his two worlds together, to share his life with the one person he hadn't yet introduced to the most important man in his life. Yet, deep down, he harbored doubts about whether his father would welcome this change, whether he was ready to open up to a new chapter in his life. Despite these reservations, Jake knew that the idea of bringing his brother into his world, of finally sharing his most private life with someone so close, was an enticing prospect. It was a chance to grow, to learn, and to strengthen the bonds that held his family together, no matter the distance. So, despite the uncertainty, Jake remained hopeful, envisioning a future where his brother and father would meet, and perhaps, just perhaps, his father would see West not just as an extension of his son but as a new friend, a new family member. This dream of unity and understanding kept Jake motivated, pushing him to find the right moment to make it happen. After all, family is about more than just blood; it's about the connections we choose to make and the effort we put into maintaining them.
